text: Bottle. Enjoyed in Brugge. Dark red color with pink head. Can taste the intense redness of this!

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 375 ml bottle, bottled 02-05-2014, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark ruby body, with a small, pinkish head. 
Aroma of sour cherries, funk, cheese, unripe fruits, sour citrus, wood. 
Tastes of oak, sour cherries, cheese, barnyard, green apples, some unripe pears. 
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finishes dry, acidic, wooden, a bit funky, fruity, with cherries, pears, apples. 

Very nice. Lovely, intense nose, with loads of funky and sour cherries notes. Taste is a bit raw, a bit less complex, while still well balanced. Overall not my favourite Kriek Ive had, but still a great style example. 
Ar/Ap/T/P/Ov: 8/4/7/4/16

0,375l botle at home shared with Saeglopur. Bottled 02.05.2014. BB 02.05.2019. bordeaux like color, small pink head. smells funk, cheese, some cherry notes, light wood, bit nutty, marzipan, light grass, light citric. nice smell. light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes some funk, citric, grassy, some fruits, light cherry, wood, bit earthy. finishes very dry and very lightly sour with notes of cherries, funk and grassy notes. very nice one, very dry and grassy, not among my favorites but a very nice one none the less.

Sample at Lizardville Westerville during the Sour Beer Night event on 05/17/2017. The beer pours a hazy ruby-purple color with a medium pinkish-white head that burns away steadily to a film. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of oak, tart cherry and yeast. Light to medium body with a tart cherry character and notes of oak, herbal yeast and doughy malt. The finish is vinous oak and sour cherry. Very good beer all around.

2014, a więc pite 3 lata po butelkowaniu. Mała butelka. Idealna barwa i (niskie) wysycenie. Piana mogłaby być bardziej bujna. Intensywne wiśnie, zgodnie z obiecankami, ale dla mnie bardziej kompot niż pestka, jak w większości krieków - na plus. Nieco winne. W sam raz kwaśne i w sam raz niesłodkie. Delikatna cierpkość. Lubię taki balans w lambikach. Pijalne tak, że najchętniej sam bym obrócił z trzy duże butelki jednego popołudnia. Cudne.
Wspaniałe dzikie, kwasne i wiśniowe. Czego chcieć więcej skoro daje wspaniałe orzeźwienie i znakomicie resetuje kubki smakowe pomiędzy pitymi RISami? Piłbym wiadrami.

750ml bottle (thx, Nick M.!) shared with wife. Bottled on 2016-04-28. Pours a very dark cherry red with a rose head. Aroma is tart with cherry and barrel notes. Taste sour with excellent cherry notes. Very nice!

September 27, 2015 - At Cask Pub & Kitchen - 375ml bottle corked & caged; my last London rating for 2015. Gorgeous bright clear refractive ruby - fantastic, and who cares about the head (which was there - smallish and beige). Aroma is tons of cherry, light oak, and oddly delicate perfume hop bitterness. Taste however - holy crap that cherry, cherry, CHERRY - sweet but very very tart; did I mention the cherry? Slick, acidic, a little still - finishes, uh, well .... CHERRY!! (I was a little drunk by this point, and happy - sue me)
Barwa krwistoczerwona, wysycenie niskie, piana niska. W aromacie koncentrat wiśniowy i pestki. W smaku to samo, tylko do potęgi. Idealny balans pomiędzy kwaśnością wisni i taninami. Genialne piwo.

0.375 l bottle from P&M Getränke, bottled in May 2014 (about three years old). Clear, intensely dark red with a thin, soapy, slowly diminishing, pinkish layer. Sourish, very fruity and slightly funky aroma of massive cherries, bitter almond, oak, some raspberries and hints of barnyard. Moderate to heavy sour, very fruity and slightly funky taste of loads of cherries, bitter almond, oak, raspberries and a touch of barnyard, followed by a medium long, rather tart, woody-dry finish. Medium body, fairly astringent, dry and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. As the name suggests, a Kriek with very intense flavours of cherry, quite sour but still well-balanced, very refreshing and elegant. Really good!

375ml bottle from julios Boston. Nose big intense cherries. Big cherry pie. Cooked cherries. Quite funky. Some wood. Wow. Taste big cherry pie. Cooked cherries. Finish cooked cherries. Very rich cherries. Sweet cherries. Very different kriek. Taste less funky and acidic than nose suggest. Nice tartness but not that sour. Amazing stuff.
Bardzo brettowe i pestkowe piwo. Wyraźny koń, stajnia i siano a to wszystko w wiśniowej otoczce :D

Bottle at Uiltje bar, Haarle (bottled 28-05-2016). Pours hazy red with a small pink head. Aroma of tart cherries, barnyard, funk, lemony sourness. Taste is overmoderate sour, light carbonation, full mouthfeel, tart cherry aftertaste. Very nice.
Pours winish red, clear, no head. Cherry exposion. But really fresh one. Hay, barn, leather. Very dry, sour. Thick, lively, very nice.

Bottle, 750 at Lambik-o-droom, with Hoon, Robin, kraddel, Miro and Travlr. Pours dark hazy red with medium off-white pinkish head. Lots of cherries, nice sourness, funk, intense indeed but so easy to drink. Balanced. Medium bodied.
W zapachu wiśnie, pestki, trochę dzikości. W smaku cudowna wiśniowość. Aż chce się pić.
W aromacie wiśnie, pestki wiśni, nuty skórzane i ziemiste, dzikość. W smaku dzikość, kwaśne wiśnie, pestki wiśni, wytrawny finisz. Mega złożone piwo, klasa.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Bottle at the source. Sour intense cherry nose and flavor. Dry finish with some dust. Enjoyable kriek.
Dark rose color. Nice Head. Great texture and feel in the mouth with significant carbonation. Cherries are really really dominant. Sourness is balanced by the fruity sweetness.
Bardzo ciemny, wiśniowy kolor. Piwo jest aż gęste od wiśni, bardzo intensywne i gładkie w strukturze. Lekka słodycz owocowa łączy się z kwaśnością. Bardzo wyraźne smaki, ale super ułożone.
2012 bottle, brilliant deep fresh sour cherries, light brett hay farmhouse, dry, vinous oak, medium malic sour, hints of lactic.
Bardzo fajne, mocno wiśniowe, mocno pestkowe, trochę dzikie, fajnie kwaśne.

Bottle pour at the RateBeer Best 2017 Grand Tasting/Bottle Share. Hazy reddish purple color. Aromas of cherries, funk, oak, berries. Tastes of cherries, funk, tart acidic notes, light oak. Light body with a dry finish.

Ruby to dark blood color with a diminishing, beige/pink head. Cherries, oak, light mineral and pits. Lightly acidic cherries along with some oak and berries. Soft light zip on the palate. Dry finish. Nicely balanced. 4/14

Really nice kriek, deep intense flavours, complex, balanced, rich. Excellent one.
0,75l bottle shared in Belge tasting @ One Pint Pub. Pours intense red with a low head. Aroma is sour malts with cherries. Flavor is sour malts, loads of cherries and some vinegar. Sublime.

Pours a near clear ruby red with a pink head. The smell is intense kriek nose which is what one would expect and some cinnamon. The taste is a bit of Jolly Rancher cherry candy without the sweetness. Big rich oriel flavor with some herbal freshness ending dry and tart. Light in body with smooth carbonation.

Merci à Luc pour le partage de cette bière que je souhaitais déguster depuis un bon moment déjà. Une kriek très clean,tant dans sa présentation que dans ce quelle offre au nez quau palais. Un funk digne de Drie Fonteinen ni trop sec, ni trop poussiéreux, ni trop minéral. Le funk est en fait aussi subtil que complexe et présente de jolies notes boisées qui saccordent parfaitement aux cerises employées. Ces dernières apportent une aromatique de grande qualité sans jamais alourdir la bière par un excès de corps. Gazéification abondante sur un ensemble très bien balancé et propre. Avec un tel label, ce nest pas du tout le genre de produit auquel je mattendais, et tant mieux. Un produit vraiment bien fait.

Bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, Greece. Pours red, Rubin with a pink head. Aromas of cherries and tart. Gently sour, cherries, red berries, and a bit of dust when it gets warm. Perfect dry aftertaste with fruity cherry flavour that lasts. Perfect

A stunning pour, 2015 vintage enjoyed with traPissed, on the nose was pure pussy juice & cherry lip balm, moist but naturally juicy aftertaste, the perfect consistency, it was my conclusion that this was the perfect time of the month to pop the cork.

This was pussy juice in a bottle....

The aromas all cherry, in particular in the clearer glass. Tons of carbonation spoils the palate. Pretty middle-of-the-road quality kriek, dominated by cherry flesh and skins, quite delicious, and a pleasant lambic bite, but definitely overpriced. Even Lou Pepe used to be less (and Scheerbeekse was half this price a decade ago).

Overpriced beer tasting 2016. 0.75l bottle, shared by Phil, thanks! Red beer, small pinkish head. Nose is cherries, caramel, sweetness, some dry notes. Flavor is tart, dry, cherries, mild funk. Very drinkable. Nice one.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 750ml bottle (Overpriced Beer Tasting 2016, thanks FatPhil). Clear red color. Tiny to almost no size pink head. Cherries, gingerbread, clove, spicy in aroma. Cherries, fruity, icy in taste. Feels watery. Clove, cherries and fruity in aftertaste. Some cinnamon bark too. Fizzy carbonation. Very drinkable brew.

Bottle (shared by fatphil, thanks). Pours red with pinkish red. Aroma is sour, funky, dry, cherries, spices, cinnamon. Flavor is sour, funky, cherries, spices, cinnamon. I like what I am getting, but feels empty. Overall: good.

Jest to młody Lambic z dodatkiem 40% wiśni. Niefiltrowany. Spontanicznie fermentowany w butelce.
Bez jakichkolwiek dodatków środków aromatyzujących lub barawiących.
Uwarzony z 60% słodu jęczmiennego, 40% słodu pszenicznego, chmielu, świeżych wiśni (400g na litr piwa) i wody.   
 Data butelkowania:  02.05.2014 
 Data ważności:  02.05.2019 
 Kolor:  Głęboko czerwony, intensywnie wiśniowy, dość czysty.
 Piana:  Jak nie trudno się domyślić piany w głębszym kontekście brak.
Na samym początku była odrobina różowego puszku, który w szaleńczym tempie zredukował się do zera.
Nie pozostawił żadnych śladów na ściankach.
Po zamieszaniu kielichem tylko na sekundę piana unosi się do góry.
Obrączki nad piwem nie ma się co doszukiwać. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest przezajebisty!
Po odkorkowaniu pierwsze skojarzania kołatają wokół stajennych, wiejskich i dzikich detali.
Jast i końska derka i spocony koń i nawet sporo skórzanego aromatu.
Kolejne skojarzenia są już wybitnie owocowe: wiśnie, czereśnie i odrobina czerwonych porzeczek.
Kropeczką nad "i" są elementy migdałów i odrobina beczkowej wanilii.
Klasa! Jestem już w połowie drogi do raju. 
 Smak: W smaku potężnie owocowe w klimacie dojrzałych półsłodkich czereśni, które po kilku łykach przechodzą w bardziej kwaśne wiśnie.
Dochodzą do tego bardzo subtelne nuty stajenne, pasek skórzany, końska derka.
Wybitnie winne, kwaśne, ale jeszcze nie octowe.
Po ogrzaniu wychodzą dziksze klimaty w stylu "funky".
Po jakimś czasie dołącza do zabawy bardzo stonowana wanilia.
Piwo daje się polubić od pierwszego łyku.
Jego dostojność podkreśla całkiem gęsta tekstura i gładkie odczucie w ustach.
Goryczka jest niemal zerowa, delikatny kwaśny finisz, który nie powoduje uczucia wykrzywiania twarzy, wręcz przeciwnie - zaprasza po kolejną porcję trunku.
Pijalność nieograniczona.
Perfekcyjny trunek. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:   

Jest to młody Lambic z dodatkiem 40% wiśni. Niefiltrowany. Spontanicznie fermentowany w butelce.
Bez jakichkolwiek dodatków środków aromatyzujących lub barawiących.
Uwarzony z 60% słodu jęczmiennego, 40% słodu pszenicznego, chmielu, świeżych wiśni (400g na litr piwa) i wody.

Trunek szczególny, szlachecki.
Od samego początku podkreśla swoją arystokratyczną wartość.
Początkowo kolorem - głęboką wiśniową czerwienią, potem smakiem, gładkim i zrównoważonym, ale zarazem intensywnym i głębokim.
Na sam koniec oczarowuje smakiem - winnym, lekko kwaśnych, wiśniowym, trochę dzikim, trochę wiejskim, trochę skórzanym i stajennym. 
Finalnie puentuje akcentami delikatnej wanilii i szczypty karmelu.
Nic mi więcej do szczęścia nie potrzeba.
To już nie jest piwo to coś pomiędzy piwem, a winem.
Trunek na szczególną, wyjątkową okazję.

75cl bottle shared with kermis and 2 friends. 
Almost no head. Hazy burgundy pour. Slightly sour.
An intense purple wine red color with a rich pitted cherry and super fruity cherry. Very sweet pitted cherry, ascerbic, almond and delicious.
Bottle. Tart cherries, almonds, red berries, all very in huge amount both in aroma and flavour. Quite sour, dry with moderate carbonation. Really good kriek.

Aroma: cherry, barnyard, leather, apple

Bottle at Brussels home tasting with cuso, Gurthnar, fajry, honza a Luká. Pours red color, small pinky head. Aroma of cherries, raspberries. Taste is sour, lot of cherries, currants. Nice.
Bottle from 3 Fonteinen. Red color with minimal pinkish head. Aroma of cherries, stones, Taste, nice fruity sourness with cherries, stones, dry finish. Nice.

Już standard 3F Kriek jest pyszny, ale tutaj jest wersja 2.0, podkręcona w każdym calu.

Deep red with a pink head. Aroma is funky cherries, cherry pie, hint of rhubarb, red currants, cherry pits. Medium bodied, well balanced palate, fruity with an earthy dry finish. Taste is cherry pie, funky cherries, cherry juice. So cherry.

Red with small pink head. Nice cherry aroma. Fruity sourness rich of cherry taste. Some bitterness on the tongue root. Cherry sour aftertaste.

red liquid with pink head. aroma of cherry juice. medium sour, cherry. light body, light feel,long finish

12.7 oz bottle, poured into a tulip at ~45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a deep actually-ruby-red red, and forms a finger head of pink foam which dies swiftly in a rush of fizzing. Carbonation is visible all over the sides of the glass at first, but vanishes before the glass is halfway drunk.

Smell: Sour cherry leaps out of the glass, as one would expect. Beneath the tart fruit, there is a haze of funky mildew, not unlike what one can smell when wandering through a building that has stood abandoned for some time.

Taste: Mildly tart, sour cherries greet the tongue as each sip begins, before fading a bit in the middle to allow shades of mildew through. During the middle, the beer takes on something of a wine character as the funk interplays with the cherries, yielding some almost tannic fruit notes of plum and red grape, with hints of hardwood. By the finish, the tart cherry returns, to leave a lingering memory of sour cherries and gentle, mildewy funk clinging to the tongue.

Mouthfeel: This starts out as a wildly prickly, highly carbonated beer, and becomes nigh completely flat by the end of the glass (which likely helped prompt my "wine character" observation of the taste). It is fairly thin, but does not turn watery, even at the finish.

Overall: An interesting kriek, though at the price point, likely not one I shall repeat. This would be a nigh perfect beer to give to a wine advocate looking into the world of beer.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep red, nose is cherry, almond, funky, taste is fruity, cherry, tart.

From a bottle at Hamiltons. Pours dark ruby brown with a very thin head. Tastes like sour cherries, delicious, lightly tart, sour apple, light yeast. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like cherries, fermenting cherries, booze, light earth.

Bottle at Hamiltons. Pours deep ruby with a medium, frothy pink head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is cherry, oak, funky and farmhouse yeast, black walnut notes and light sweet malt. Flavor is sweet cherries, oak, light pale malt, lightly tart, funky and farmhouse yeast notes with a dry finish. Medium body and light carbonation.
From a bottle at Pizzeria Paradiso Alexandria. Pours a clear ruby red with a pink head. Vinous bandaid aroma. Flavors of tart cherry. Puckering finish.
375ml Bottle - Dark red in colour. Black cherries, almonds and some woody notes in the aroma. Fruity and sharp taste with a fair amount of tartness and notes of cherries, blackcurrant and some oak.
375 bought a year ago. Surprisingly not that sour. Nice cherry flavor of course. Finish has some garbage though, but in some ways its nicely funky.

[6554-20140723] Bottle. Black cherry sour yeast aroma. Murky, dark dark red body with a quick pink foamy head. Cherry-infused sour yeast flavour. Medium body is a little sour. Good. (7/4/7/4/16) 3.8
(w/ DuctTape, jercraigs, JoeMcPhee)

Bottle @ Heeren Van Liederkerke tuinfestival. Pours very dark red, pink head. Aroma has cherries, lemon, wood. Taste is quite sweet, lots of cherries, and a nice sour to top it off. 
Very nice fruity sour.

I had a bottle of this once before in Chicago, which I enjoyed (despite the price). I had this again recently in a blind tasting. I remember it was very cherry, I thought it was going to be 3F Schaerbeekse Kriek. It was just so much cherry juice, all natural and nothing harsh about the lambic. It beat out Lou Pepe Kriek but I still enjoyed Cantillon Kriek .1 more, which is really not much of a difference (unless we think of price).
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle courtesy of Travlr - Thanks! The Bride announced that she wanted to save this for a special occasion, which last for about 90 minutes. Ah well...Anyway, this was really good. Very sour, but plenty of cherry flavor. Plenty of balsamic vinegar and red wine notes to really round out the flavor, too. Great stuff.

P: Very dark red, looks like blood just a bit darker with a thin pink head. S: Sugar, cherries, lemons, vinegar, wood, wheat, limes, and perfume. T: Oh man, this is sugary sweet, loaded with cherries, oak, lime sourness in the back. M: Medium body, light carbonation with a sour bite. O: Really good stuff that is very sweet.

Nov 2012 bottle. Dark red pour with a small pink head that fades to a nice ring. Aroma is cherry medicine, vanilla, red wine vinegar, earth, and light barnyard funk. Big cherry skin taste mixed with vanilla, vinegar, and wood. Fairly acidic. Light to moderate sourness. Big, tart, dry finish with a touch of sweetness too. I thought I was going to like this more. Its a tad medicinal and not sour enough.

Deep blood red with no head. Aroma is cherry with a little peppermint type smell. Tart cherry with a vinous quality. A cheese funk settles into the tongue. Slightly watery mouthfeel that ends dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A red wine color no head. Smells of sour cherry, vanilla, a little funky, a small bit of chemical. A smooth baking cherry sour taste, a hint of vanilla, a slightly buttery taste, a bit of oaky hop. Slick mouthfeel, dry. Satisfying smooth sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2015 37,5cl, bottled 13-11-2012 for its first 37,5cl introduction on Tour de Gueuze in 2013. Aged approx. 2 years and 2 months (today end january 2015). Pours burgundy red, slowly fading head, good retention. Complex aroma of cherries, lots of oak, esters. In a fresh Intense Red, I find the aromatic fragrances are somewhat disturbed by the high carbonation and sourness. The lack of CO2 allow the darker mellower flavours to come out. This baby is less sour and soft. Meaty cherries upfront followed by more than rich almonds. Plum-like complex cherry-oak character, slightly sweet, a tad sour on the palate. Lots of tannines and even with little age, the fruit keeps on delivering. Especially in the last residu pour! Interested in tasting the next in 2 to 3 years.

37,5 cl bottle, fresh - 11-7-2014. Dark red pour and cherry scent all over. Sticky red fruits, cherry, sirup, slightly medicinal character. Aroma intertwines with the light-soury cherry lambic flavour in a balanced manner. Cherry aftertaste lingers on Carbonation is a bit high for my taste but sour is mild. Lovely!

375ml bottle in a teku. Pours deep pinkish/purple with an off-white head. Aroma of sourness and cherries mainly, some light funk, hints of spices, some pale malts, and maybe some earthiness. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything with the strong cherries and tartness. Average texture. A solid beer.

A 500 ml bottle shared by JK. Pours a deep scarlet red colored brew with a fast dissipating off-white head that leaves behind a thin film top. Aroma of intense cherries (as described in its name) with a hint of brown sugar and light funk. Taste is medium to full bodied, with flavors of cherry pie filling, some sweet/tart candy presence and some light funk. Finish is semi-sweet at first, followed by a mild tart funk.
Deep red with small pink head. Aroma is cherry perfume and some earth. Fruity palate. Aftertaste is dry, tart and very fruity. Overall: nice! Lacks complexity.
Bottle. Purple - red pour. Awesome tart cherry aroma. Cherry pie filling. Slight funk. Tart taste. Dry finish. Awesome!

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Bottle shared by Bvery...thanks buddy! Pours dark reddish purple with minimal head. Smells of really sour cherry bomb. Taste the same with a little wood. Great finish. Really good beer.

Deep jammy nose with plums, dark cherries and a gorgeous violet flower note. Luxurious, plush fruit character. Red wine vinegar, brown sugar, dark honey. Brandied cherry flavor is deepened within the warm, deep body that offers only the softest carbonation and clean acids. Maybe a bit unremarkable, as far as nuances go, but I love the warmth and classic fruit character of this.

Location: Bottle shared by Eric, 9/27/14, Rating #3950! Closing in on 4k!


Aroma: The nose is fruity and tart, a little wood, a little funk, and some sweet malts

Appearance: It pours a nice reddish color with a pink/off-white looking head

Flavor: The taste balances the sweet, tart, funky, and wood flavors rather effectively 

Palate: The mouthfeel is quite nice, complex and enjoyable feel, and it is still pretty drinkable

Overall Impression: 
This is a very nice one. I really enjoyed this. Thanks for the share, Eric! Theres some good complexity here, and the fruity and funky flavors blend really nicely.
Another perfect beer! Sweet and sour battle it out on your taste buds, and it still ends in a draw. Cherries come through in both aroma and taste, tartness leaves your palate tingling. Excellent!

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 2012 bottle at home. For my own little bbf afterparty. Cork popped without any notice of carbonation. Poured flat as a red wine. In a deep dark red colour.with some pink lacing. Big fresh cherries aroma, amarena, acid, still some sourness in the back. But the sweetness of the cherries have the leading role in this one.
Nice cherry smell and taste. I think this one is better than Lou Pepe Kriek and 3F Schaerbeekse Kriek.
Bottle with dutchsdrebus. Deep red color with a small pink head. Smells and tastes fruity, red fruit, cherries, raspberry, sweet, sour.

Bottle shared with Angela. Deep ruby colour with a small pink head. Smells mint, cherry, cherrypeel, sourish, astringent. Tastes sour, mint, cherry, cherry peel, slightly dusty, wood. Thin to medium body, soft carbo. Decent, but lets not act like this is jofel.

"Well... Color as advertised, a beautiful intense ruby red. Immediate pungent aroma of bright tart cherries and an underlying stinky cheese. Flavor is more than adequately sour, very fruity and intense as well, with the cherry/funk balance done to near perfection. Dam smooth too, carbonation just right, and the abv (which happens to be 5.0) is irrelevant. This could have been 3% or 9% and the flavor would have made it so you didnt even notice. Super friggin expensive, but a real treat. Up there with Cantillon Lou Pepe in the ranks of the best krieks."
Pours a deep Ruby color with a minimal rose colored head and low retention. Smells like a tart cherry cordial. Tastes of a moderately sweet dark cherry flavor with a lingering sourness.

Bottle shared in London during the CBC 2nd birthday. Pours deep red-purple with a creamy pink head. The nose has dank grapes, funk, cherries, berries. Light to medium sweet flavor with ripe and funky fruits, cherry, some skin. Light to medium bodied with average+ carbonation. Lots of ripe, drying berries to finish, good assertive tartness. Great one.
Bottle. Purple pour with tan head. Whole cherries, tart aromas. Flavors are sweet and tart cherries flavor; very fruit forward, nice fruit lambic.
Poured a deep red color with aromas of cherries, light funk, some oak, and more cherries. Flavors were cherry juice, not overly tart or sour, just enough, tasty and great, need to find more of this.

Pour is transparent blood red with almost no head, a touch of dark purple foam on top. Nose has lots of cherry up front with a moderate amount of funk. Its gets a bit leathery after the traditional earthy mushroomy funk with a bit of rubber band. Taste is stronger cherry, pitted ripe dark red cherry. The funk is lighter, a touch earthy and some rubber band through the back. Fairly sour finish with a light body and strong carbonation.

Flaska från Brill. Rödvinsfärgad vätska, lågt rosa skum som snart försvinner. Stor syrlig doft av moreller, geuze, lite hallon. Syrlig, frisk, stram, torr och massor av bär. lite annorlunda körsbärssmak än andra kriek, drar lite åt hallon, lätt kärnbeska i eftersmak med lätt touch av hallon. Riktigt god.

Thanks to jercraigs for this one. Deep ruby red pour. Rich garnet colour with a pink light head. The nose is loaded with cherry and rich earthy character. A lot of soft funky aromatics and a nice chewy leathery character. Has a great richness to it. Lovely brew.

2014-07-23. Dark red purple body with a small pink head. 3+ Strong cherry aroma, light funk. 7++ Flavour is quite fruity, mildly sour throughout but it grows as you go. Lightly lactic touches, with vinous notes in the finish and aftertaste. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+ Pretty nice but not particularly complex compared to some of their other offerings. Bottle via trade with Duffman

375ml bottle pours a bright, neon lipstick red with some cloudy, pink head. Nose has bright berry, cherry and raspberry, some cinnamon stick too. Flavor is lightly tart, lightly sweet, bright cherry juice, some raisin too. Fairly balanced finish.

Bottle shared thanks to lithy. Pours a dark reddish purple like red wine. Aroma of big cherry, farmhouse, wet hay. The taste is tart and sweet. The aftertaste is like ludens chatty cough drops. Big cherry syrup here. Thick mouthfeel.
Pretty good. Simple cherries, some funk, mostly tart, good carbonation, good summer beer by the H20.
Bottle thanks to tasting at Arts. Poured clear red with light pink white head. Aroma is slightly sour farm. Simple sour cherry taste.

Bottle, thanks David for sharing. This was really yummy. Pours deep bloody, red wine red with a thin off white/pinkish lace. Nose is intense as the name suggests. Lots of deep sour cherry, light vinegar, oak. Flavor is similar-lots of tart cherry, vinegar, light vanilla, oak. Really yummy kriek.
very deep red with almost no head. Aroma is oaky, funky, some attic notes. Vinegarish, massive cherry but also balanced sourness. Very tart. Very good.

Bottle shared at home. Pours deep red purple with barely any head. Aroma is fairly funky, dank cellar, cobwebs and tart cherries. Flavor is light sweet and moderate acidic. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle, bought @De Hopduvel, Gent. Pours deep, well intense, red with a small, fizzy, pink head. Stays as a thin film. Aroma has lots of cherry, tart, light marzipan, red apple zest. Low carbonation, tart and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has tartish, a lot of cherry, mild sweet marzipan, light vinegar. Exquisite balance.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep reddish rose color with a thin light pink head. Aroma is dry, tart, light cherry. Flavor is intensely sour, just as the name says. Cherry syrup. Oily body with a lingering cherry tartness. Quite delicious.

Ruby red color, with a small, fizzy head. Fantastic aromas of ripe cherries, wine, along with a slightly funky impression. Has a lively carbonation, bready soft malts, which interact well with the huge, but gentle cherry fruitiness. At no point does the sourness of this beer roll over the fruity cherry impression, which comes along with red vinous grapes and a subtle oak defined maltiness. Bretts stay in the background of the composition, they only support the cherries with an enjoyable tartness in the end, accompanying the fermented fruits. Oakiness goes incredibly well with the bursting cherries print, exposing their full-bodied, smooth fruitiness. Wine and oak define the body of this beer, leading to a never before experienced, well balanced, superior cherry fruitiness.
Wonderful cherries. I could smell it a meter away. Ripe cherries, on verge of sour, nice balance. Did not like the thick syrup palate. But everything else was excellent.

A head to head sour off between the Mikkeller Frederiksdal (MF) and the 3 Fonteinen Intense Red (IR) : Served a same temps and in same glasses. Both display a beautiful crimson hue with mostly lasting but small pink head. The MF had a slight better head and slight deeper rose hue but really both are very pretty. Both get a 5 from me.  The aroma of the MF seems sweeter and has some Diacetyl undertones, more like a candied cherry with a bit of horseblanket and cheesy funk. The IR diplays even more wild yeast notes of farmyard and cat pee along with a more vibrant cherry vapour. Clear win for the IR, 9 to 6. The taste of the MF is cherry, candi sugar, oak, earthiness and a moderate lactic acid. I really like the well stated oak character but wished the sourness would pop more. The IR is surprisingly tamer than expected, seem defiantly more Oude Lambic with a softer fruitiness, smoother oak and earthiness and some pity undertones. Whilest the MF does have than candied tone, it is a tad more expressive and complex. The IF could have use a bit more younger kriek in the blend. Slight edge to the MF 8 to 7.  Mouth feel: The MF is a touch sticky and a faintly noticeable alcohol/ band-aid finish. The IR is so smooth and rich tannins, almost too smooth for its own good considering it was suppose to be "intense". Still I would give the IR the upper hand due to the band-aid on the MF. IR=4, MF=3.  and finally overall judgement... I like both brews for their high points but felt letdown by the low points. More good than bad... perhaps the wild yeasties will clean up the Mikkeller Frederiksdal (15). The 3 Fonteinen Intense Red already seems past prime but only slightly so, it had a higher letdown factor and therefore a lower overall score (13) but the total win IR 3.8 and MF 3.7
Hazy reddish orange. Nose is cherry candies, sweet and tart cherries, some funk. Taste is the same, much sweeter than I had expected or hoped for. Smooth and easy drinking.

Pours clear ruby

Smell big candy, cherry

Taste light tart, cherry, sugar plum

Light body

Great

Bottle from Belmont Station in Portland. 2012 Vintage.
Deep red with a ring of white head. Smells like fruit jam. 
Not mouth-puckering sour but has a very palatable tartness. Lots of juicy cherry. Finish is dry and acidic.

2014-05-18

Poured from bottle into sample glass (Kriek-off): Pours purple with a purple fluffy head. Aroma of sweet cherries and barnyard. Taste is very sweet with a finish like cherry or grape Nerds candy. Not very tart. This one kind of missed the mark for me.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours murky and dark red with a purple tint and no head. The nose is a fruity marriage of sour cherries and raspberry jam, accompanied by a moderate component of vanilla. Medium-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor offers generous measures of sour cherries and sweet raspberries. Finishes crisp, tart, and then Mojave-dry. Shared by landhoney; this is yet another world class beer from Armand at 3 Fonteinen!

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pours slightly hazy dark red with a small pink head. Aroma is quite sweet with cherries, some tartness and a little bit of barnyard. Taste is sweet with a soft sourness, cherries, cassis and a bit of barnyard. Dry finish. Medium body and carbo.

Cloudy purple with a small, light purple head.
Strong cherry, bubblegum aroma.
Taste is tart cherry, light mustiness....
Loaded with bold flavor.
Slight woody hints.
Very nicely done.

Man...fantastic beer. What else can I say? Near perfect. Aroma was mouthwatering. Strong sour cherry, funk and vinegar aromas that all carried through to the flavor. Aggressively sour with oak, cherry and vinegar tearing the insides of your cheeks apart. Stunning dark red color with a pink ring for a head. Medium carbonation which was actually a good surprise because when I took the cork out there was no cap. Long and strong sour finish.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Deep reddish pour. Fair head. Smells mildly sour, dry, Cherries, Basement. Taste is crisp cherry. Some graham cracker. Dry, but not so dry its dusty. Still juicy..rich. A moderate, very drinkable tongue smacking sour.

Une bouteille de 375ml. avec un bouchon de liège. Un robe rouge foncée qui rend hommage au mot intense. Un nez tout aussi intense de cerise et détable. La bouche est tout en cerise, elle nest pas trop acide, agréable, simple et facile. Riche elle se laisserait boire à grandes lampés, pauvre on la déguste à petites gorgées.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 75cl bottle shared by US barrel-based group @NachtvdGrote Dorst, Eizeringen 2014, thanks! An impressive Ochsenblut-purple pour prepares for a pure and straight-up fruit (red berries, sour and sweet cherry) symphony so fresh that it overshadows most beer, even lambiek character. Obviously top-notch in its gorgeous juiciness, but I prefer lambieks with more of a funky hop kick and tangy earthiness to them, not their Radler version at double the price of a Kriek.
Donkere paarse kleur met een goede paarse kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kers, cassis en kruiden. Smaakt fruitig, kers, iets zuur.
Bottle. Tart cherry, oak, light vinegar, and malt aroma. Hazy ruby red with minimal head. Nice, smooth musty/dry red cherry and malt flavor. Great blending. Smooth as silk. Lives up to its name.

Color rubí oscuro con espuma rosada. Aromas seco de madera, frutos rojos, sal de frutas. Cuerpo medio-alto con un sabor dulce y afrutado de inicio ,que va aportando acidez hasta un final seco de madera, que dura hasta el regusto. Muy rica.
Shared bottle to snifter. Beautiful red and clear. Funky aroma. Huge cherry flavor. Tart and delicious. Syrupy and winey.

This pours a dark red color with a slight, pink head. The aroma is strong with sweet cherries. The taste is unusual as it is very strong with a tart, dry taste rather than a sweet taste. The texture is smooth and thin, not as bold as I was expecting. Fairly decent but as far as cherry lambics go, there are better ones on the market.

Dark ruby red pour, pink head, cool man. Aroma, fantastic, barnyard funk, sour cherries, some slight sweetness. Taste, tart tart tart up front, very dry, crisp, mild sour finish, very nice a bit subdued but overall very well done.

Une robe rouge comme du vieux sang. Une tête qui nen est pas une. Un nez largement fruité sur un fond de lambic. On dirait bien quil y a dautres fruits que les cerises dans cette concoction. Des saveurs collées aux arômes. On dirait que les cerises noires sont mélangées à des framboises et des canneberges. Les notes aigrelettes manquent peut-être de vigueur ou de finesse. En bouche, le liquide fait son style. En finale, cest aigre-doux, fruité et court.

Ale Alpharetta. Thanks for bringing this GTAEGeek. Pours bright red/pink with fizzy pink head. Its not as intense as the name suggests, but was very flavorful and lightly tart. The cherries were really the showcase, with medium tart punch, tad bit of funk. Light and lively on the palate. Nice.

375 mL bottle shared at Ale Alpharetta. Pours dark red, with a small, pink head. The aroma is a lot of cherries, but not in a medicinal way, with some lactose and wheat. Strong fructose sweetness, with a nice, funky sourness. Medium to heavy body, sticky, and syrupy. Overall, this is more fruit than lambic, but still an enjoyable and delicious beer.

A really awesome Kriek. The pour is a dark burgeoning red with a pink, foamed up head. The nose is tart and fruity with big juicy cherries and a light sour acetic note. A bit sweet in the middle with tons of juicy fruit notes and a light candied flavour. The finish is tart and acidic but not as sour as I thought after the nose. A good brew with tons of cherry flavour.
Had this at a great neighborhood tasting. Thanks to everyone for sharing! Had so much fun!
Bottle @ Ale&Hop. Very dry and intense cherry aroma and taste. Very good but not so very drinkable anymore as less intense ones.-- rated with beerbasher/Lumia 1020

Pours a deep red with very few bubbles. Aroma is cherries, moderately sour, lemony and a light wood touch. Flavour is tart fruity notes, sour cherry, lemony, mild brettanomyces , wood, and a fairly dry finish.

Bottle from somewhere...cant remember how I acquired. Pours a deep reddish purple with a small purple head. Head was gone in about 20 seconds. A serious tart cherry nose with a red wine-like base. Notes of citrus and flowers. The taste is less complex actually, which was surprising. Not quite as tart as expected either. Certainly a semi tart cherry with notes of other tart fruits. A red wine taste with less tannins. Mostly a dry, semi-sweet finish. No carbonation. Very light body. Overall rather mediocre for this brewery.

This one poured a bright red color with a nice pink head, definitely a cherry beer. Aroma was of lots of sour cherries, light lemon, some hay and seed pits. Flavor was not nearly as sour as the nose suggested it would be, nice mildly tart cherries, more on the wild side than an actually sour, but great cherry presence and very refreshing.

Bottle , pours purple/red with no head. Aroma is funk and sour cherries , very nice aroma, cherry lollipop. Taste is semi tart cherry, a bit sweet then tart again, funk, dry puckery finish. Does a great job of being intense with it flavor and also clean and delicate. Good stuff.

Super intensywnie czerwone, a wlasciwie bordowe piwo. Z srednia ale rozowa piana. Przepieknie pacznace swierzymi wisniami. A w smaku poezja owocowosci. Powalajaca dominacja wisni. Sok syrop z tych owocow dominuje. W smaku tak jakby zerwac swierza wisnie z drzewa. Pod koniec piwo jest metne naturalne i coraz bardziej wytrawne. Leciutko tylko cierpkie. Posmak na koncu jakby przegryzc pestke. Super alternatywa dla luksusowych win. Wspaniale do wolowiny. Polecam

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 12.7 oz bottle poured into shaker. Clear red to purple with no head or lacing. Aroma is tart cherries, cherry cough syrup, sour cherry, breadcrumb malt, and some oak. Taste is moderately sour with lactic acidity under cherry skin flavors, lightly sweet cherry juice, and if you focus there?s a little wood and leather bitterness; the medicinal flavor is prominent, which I find unfortunate. Light to medium body, sticky texture, low carbonation, and a lip-puckering dry finish.

12.7 oz bottle pours a dark ruby red with a thin spotty pink purple head. Aroma is musky, mild funk, tart cherries, very nice mellow oak. Taste really nails a unique sweet tartness if the cherries I havent seen in a kriek before, cherries present tart and sour but with a sweet fruit juice presence. Lacto and oak also help to round out a nice balance. Awesome, Ill be picking up more of this next time I see it!

375 mL bottle courtesy of Tyson, served in a snifter. Pours intense red wine with a small pink head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves no lace. The nose has huge notes of cherry and flowers, along with dust, subtle earth and dust. The flavour is balanced, mildly tart and moderately sweet, with a load of cherries. The finish is medium in length and soft with more cherries. On the palate it is medium in body with a silky smooth texture. Overall, this is a very nice kriek. Full of cherries but also delicate. 2014-03-08
Pours from a 375 mL bottle. Dark red-purple with a quickly fading pink head. Nice lacing. Aroma is sour cherry, dark berry, vinegar, port, with a crisp sour ascerbic finish. I love it.

Celebratory bottle into a Drie Fonteinen wine glass the night the Blackhawks won the cup. Pours a vivid blood red-purple. Nose is strong cherry with heavy skins and a bit of pit. Mild acidity with a nice earthiness alongside plenty of cherry skin and fruit. A bit heavy on the fruit compared to the base lambic, but still quite nice.

Cork opened with the most minimal pop. Pours purple with a nice small pink head. The aroma has lush cherries, cream, some tartness, citric bite, hints of vinegar and it all has a very clean pureness to it. Medium crisp body with very restrained carbonation (low pop indicated this). It starts out with a very citric bite (on lemony side), bugginess, some tart cherry (not as overt as aroma predicted) and a bit more malt presence than expected. The finish is short and sharp with the tart cherry aspect coming out more and some phenolic spice. Very solid.

Dark ruby red pour with no head just a light rose hued collar around the edge of the glass. Aroma is all about the sour cherries with notes of wine. Flavor is very similar, so delicious. Wonderfully tart but not over the top sour with lots of cherry. Perfectly balanced between the fruit and sour characteristics. This one definitely deserves all the praise that it gets. Amazing brew.

Aroma is musty funk, bubble gum, sour cherries. Appears dark red, pink head great lacing. Taste is sour, backend bitter cherries. The mouthfeel is plush. Full bodied and soft. Taste has lemony sour characteristics.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Bottle: Deep, ruby & crimson color allowing some light to pass through, topped with no actual head, just a mild, lavender-tinted collar. Aroma is full of candied cherries, both sweet & sour, but more so on the sweet side. Light lemon & lacto tartness builds up with just a hint of corky funk, though not much. Taste starts with some sour cherry & lightly acidic lemon flesh, but quickly leads into a more mellow sweetness; cherry jam with sugary cracker crust. I get some mild spiced notes throughout, almost like timid cinnamon & lavender, but its hard to exactly pinpoint. Oak in the finish with more cherry & a light apple-like fruit presence. Could use more carbonation. A very nice, well crafted kriek ale, although perhaps falling short of the brewers other krieks.
Bottle at Craft Clerkenwell; dark ruby red pour with tiny pink head, red wine vinegar nose with a discreet funk, taste is lip puckering sour with loads of intense cherry flavour, impressive beer.
Intense fruitiness yet lacks the finesse that for instance the lou Pepe series from Cantillion delivers. That being said, its a very quaffable kriek and is highly recommended
Bottle at home. Tart cherry and cherry pit aroma. Dark ruby red pour, fizzy head. Taste is tart cherry jam. Acidity kicks in at the end. Medium to high carbonation. Great beer.

Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Dyp rød farge. Tynn skumrand. Lav karbonering. Smaker gjær, kirsebær, kirsebærstein, bær, syre, hint av eik. Denne lambicen oser av herlig ,syrlig frukt. 3 fonteiner leverer igjen. Svært god
Dark red pour, with a small pink head. Aroma consists of ripe cherry, lime, and some, yeasty lambic qualities. Taste is a medium/light sour, with a light mouthfeel, soft carbonation and rather dry.

Bottle purchased at Binnys. Thanks to DontDrinkBeer for telling me about this place. Dark crimson in color with a fingers worth of light pink head. Excellent head retention despite very little lacing. Nose is almost all cherry with some light funk and a touch of lemon rind. Flavor is equally cherry forward, but has taken on some acidity since its release. Still "jammy", but definitely starting to get that traditional 3F funkiness. Mouthfeel is light to moderate, light acidity, good carbonation, and a moderate finish. Fuck the haters, this beer tastes fantastic now and will only get better as it ages.

Delicious beer. One of the better cherry beers I have had. Rich, tart, complex and mouthwatering cherry flavors exude from the start to the finish to the aftertaste. There werent any synthetic-tasting, cough-drop cherry flavors (typical of so many cherry beers), either. There were also some wholesome, earthy and complex flavors of wood (from the oak barrels and/or cherry pits, if included) and vanilla. There was only a mild sourness, but it was really pleasant. UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 375mL bottled 11/13/2012, drunk on 1/21/14.Deep neon-garnet tinted cote du rhone-colored body is topped by a cranberry flecked, cream-white head. Slow to recede. High clarity, very light on bubbles. Lees en bouteille.Lightly tart black cherry notes are meaty, fresh and as authentic as can be. Just a brush of brown sugar and balsamic vinegar, as cherries run deep but lead to a clear horsecrap note (sulphur, very light) that is tremendously endearing. "Ahhhh, this one was going splendidly until I got to the notes of horse poop...then it really got good!" How I ever came to enjoy smelling farm animal poop in my beer, Ill never know. Anywyas, this stuff is fantastic, if a bit reserved. The cherries are done magnificantly, but I could see getting a little crazier, bacteria-wise. That being said, young krieks are very cherry-dominated and you cant ask for a wealth of funk this early. Id be surprised if this one dosent develop plenty of character over the next few+ years.Acetone and lactic acid are bright and eye-opening on first sip. The hard sourness, outdoing even the fresh malic acids from the cherries, is a bit shocking from 3F. That being said, I dont know why Im shocked, I havent had a 3F lambic in a long, long time (6 years...). Unfortunately, the body immediately gives way to a watery texture and bit of thinness. The palate adjusts quickly to the sourness, which seems to evaporate as the beer breathes and warms. Tart, tooth-cleaning acids and plentiful unripe lime flavor are robed in tart cherry and finish with a malic/acetic "sweetness" (relative to the sourness the yeast imparts). Stunning flavor, cant find much fault with that. The body, however, you can. I certainly dont mind that the body is thin and watery, as it just makes it more sessionable. Unfortunately, I didnt win the lottery, so I cant drink this as a session beer. So yes, would prefer a good deal more carbonation up front and barring that, just a more supple body to really carry the flavor. Great though and gave me goosebumps (seriously) from this being my first 3F in 6 or 7 years.  9/4/8/3/162014 bottle, drunk 9/9/16.Without going too in depth here, suffice to say that this one had the same lovely cherry pit/cherry meat flavor as the prior bottle but seemed even more thin.  Almost more akin to a cherry berliner weisse or random American wild ale with cherries.  Just doesnt have the malt/wheat backbone, nor any depth whatsoever.  As well, the lambic is a little bit sparse, being comprised mostly of tart brett acids adding lime and guava.  Some black pepper and more cherry pit are enjoyable, on the finish, but its very lacking overall.  Score is for this bottle.

Bottle shared by Tony S. Pours dark red color with light pink head. Aromas of sour cherries and funk. Sour cherry flavor with moderate sourness, funkiness and sweetness. Light to medium body with average carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Re-rate 3/12/16: Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. 2012 bottle. Lovely deep red color with a small pink head. Huge jammy cherries aroma with cherry pits and a light medicinal note. Wonderful tart and sweetish jammy cherries flavor with mild funk. Medium-bodied. Wonderful, juicy and jammy. 8/5/9/4/17=4.3

[10/6/13] Bottle at CASK Pub & Kitchen in London. Beautiful very deep red with a lovely pink head. Great aroma full of cherries, some barnyard and some oak. Sourish flavor, bursting with cherries, with mild fruity sweetness, some lovely funk and light lemony hints. Silky mouthfeel. Amazing. 8/5/9/4/17=4.3

Great beer that pours a ruby reddish brown pour with fizzy fading head. Aroma is ripe sweet cherries and some funk. Taste is moderately tart with a sweetish fruity cherry finish. The funk is pretty strong but the amount of overipe cherry sweetness balances nicely.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2013.
Appearance: Red colour with a pink head.
Aroma: Sour, cherries, fruit, malt.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Cherries, sour, fruit, tart. Sour finish.

Bottle, shared. Pours deep, deep black-red, almost impenetrable. Nose is ripe, fleshy cherry, cider vinegar, wool, fresh yogurt. Big acetic bite on the front palate, soothed by sweet cherry after. Dry finish. Superb.

Bottle. Pour is deep reddish purple with a medium reddish purple head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is bursting with sweet cherry notes followed by sugary cherry Kool-aid and a light funky tartness. Flavor is much less sweet than the aroma. Loaded with cherry tartness and a light funk. The cherry is present but is more in the background than the aroma led me to believe. Not overly complex but quite good. A great beer.

Bottle, 375ml. A deep red beer with a small, pinkish head. Lots of cherries in the aroma, some almonds. Not much funk. Sour flavor with loads of cherries. Almond notes and some lemon. Dry, tart mouthfeel, medium body. Long finish with the same copious amounts of cherries found both in the aroma and in the initial flavor. Nice. 131019

Bottle. Deep, intense (yes, I said it) garnet red colour with a dark pinkish-purple head that recedes quickly. This is the most beautiful hue of red Ive ever seen in a beer. The aroma is very interesting: funky yeast with notes of body odour, concord grapes, and new leather. Very funky palate, lightly medicinal, juicy concord grape, dark cherries, light pepper, light petroleum, grappa-like dryness. Incredible balance makes for supreme drinkability, gulpability. Wow.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours a dark red colour with a small pink head that disappears quite fast. Quite sweet aroma of cherries, wet wood and some small scenses of citrus. Flavour has a lot cherries of course, not as sour as Id hoped, but very nice. Light body with a tad watery mouthfeel. A very good beer indeed, but with some slight issues

Wow. Deep dark burgundy pour with only a rosy border of head. Aroma of concentrated raspberry and black cherry. Flavor is sour cherry and pomegranate. Lighter than I expected at first, but the flavor is so much more full as it warms a little.

Opens sweet and tart cherries. Puckering in the middle with more fruit and hints of cobweb, oak, and barnyard funk. Very juicy throughout. Simpler and less funky than the other Kriek offerings from Drie Fonteinen. End is puckering and accented with a fruity finish. Excellent.

10/15/2013. 375 ml. corked and caged bottle. Dark red with a short pinkish head. Funky yeast aromas with cherries present. Tart at first sip, medium carbonation, cherries show well and finishes sour and tart. Fantastic lambic.

Bottle from Proof. Deep crimson color pour with a small red head. Nose presents layered yeast funk, old dough, leather and tons of black cherries and definitely becomes more strong as it warms up. Tart lemon sourness on the tip of the tongue, fading into yeast funkiness, leather, sourdough ending on a big sour cherry notes. Moderate carbonation a smooth sour mouthfeel. Goddamn delicious.

Bottle. Poured hazy reddish color with an average fizzy reddish head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate complex tart cherry aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and lively carbonation. Heavy sour cherry flavor with a medium to heavy tart sour finish of long duration. Refreshing brew that is a standout.

Bottle @ SBWF.
Pours a brilliant deep ruby red, with a pink red.
Fruity, spicy, funky aroma, cherries, oak, citrus, brett.
Dry, medium body, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Fruity, funky, acidic taste, oak, raspberries, cherries, grapefruit.
Very tart, lovely complexity. Great. (2013-10-03)

Bottle shared at Bettola, august 27nd 2013. Its got a deep ruby colored body, with a dark pink head. Red enough. Funky aroma of cherries, wood, marcipan, taste is massive cherry, sour but with a jam-like sweet presence, oak, red wine. Light alcohol feel, with a rather sweet cherry and funky finish. Lasting sour aftertaste with, yes, cherries.

Dark crimson, scarlet, and garnet pour with a razor thin cotton candy head. Aggressive black cherry nose with some unripened dark fruit, lemon sourness, Merlot, and funk. Flavor is loaded with cherry pie filling, plum, fig, prune, raisin, and grape. The dark fruit additions go beyond Bing, Maraschino, and Rainier. Again, get a Syrah quality here with a light peppery finish. Tart but not lip puckering. Also get some wood and earthiness. A really good brew!

375, corked and baled. Thanks, J! Pours a clear dark rubied garnet with a loose fizzy pink head. Bright sweet tart cherry pie nose, nice sourness blended back perfectly against a lovely fruity sweetness. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Beautifully integrated oak, tartness, and sweetness on the mid palate. So approachable but beautifully complex. Long tart finish.

375ml bottle into tall Rastal flute. Pours a dark cherry colour, with pink coloured head, which dies down to a lacing. Aromas of black cherry, wood, pencil shavings, funky sweat. Taste is soured black cherry, wood, lemon pith bitterness, little bit of blue cheese funkiness, & syrupy sweetness. Not as sour as I was expecting, given the name, but nice & subtle, nonetheless. Light to medium bodied with pleasant soft carbonation, somewhat thin, sticky sweet texture, leading to a dry, ruby red grapefruit-like bitter sour finish. Pleasant enough, but a little too sweet for my liking.

Bottle at SBWF. Pours beautiful clear red with a nice pink head. Aroma is lots of sour cherries with a nice funky note with hay and oak in the background. Taste is medium tart, cherries and a dry tart finish.

Bottle shared thanks to scotchzi. Pours a plum red with thin pink white lacy head that leaves light lace. Aroma of sour cherry and farm house funk. Taste is smooth earthy cherry, hint of funk, tart back end. Refreshing but intense, dry finish, not over the top though. Yes!

375ml bottle pours a black cherry color with a finger of pink head that leaves a nice ring of lacing near the surface of the glass. Aroma is cherries and red wine. Taste is a sour lemon and cherry tartness with some fruit and malt sweetness finishing dry like a red wine. Medium body with decent carbonation. The cherry is more dominant than I would like, but overall this is still a solid brew.

Bottle @ Jesperhus Camping. Pours dark red with a small creamy pink head. Aroma is light sour, rich cherries, cherry stones, calk. Flavor is rather sweet and a little sour with cherries, almond, cheery stones, hints of x-mas spice, marcipan. Medium body, soft carbonation, light acidic finish. 280913

A: Deep Black Cherry Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Pink Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Tart Cherries, Pie Cherries

T: Tart Cherries, Red Plums, Mildly Watery

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Sweet

Overall, maybe this bottle needs a couple of years but was not overly impressed given who the brewery is, I would expect more from Drie Fonteinen.

12.7oz bottle, split with caterwaul. Beautiful wine-like dark red color; clear. Thin pink, sort of bubbly head. A bit or two of lace. Big cherry nose... I was smelling cherry syrup as I poured this from 2 feet away. Nice oak in the nose... Big on the black cherry, rather than the sour type. Hint of chocolate in that complex cherry aroma. Taste... Is not as puckering sour as I expected this to be. Its light to moderate sour, for a kriek, with some syrupy sweetness. Medium body, very light, sort of crisp carbonation. I might have liked a little bit more carbonation. Lightly sticky in the finish, but pretty easy-drinking, still. Very tasty, easy drinking cherry lambic overall

Bottle - Pours deep ruby with no head. Nose is real deep, dark cherries, Ludens lozenges, and just a little tartness. Taste is lots of dark cherry pie filing, lightly tart and sweet, and real dense. Medium-carbonation and medium-bodied. This is a real treat.

Corked half bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagenbatch 13-11-2012, bb 13-11-2017Faithful to its name, it pours an intense ruby color, with small pink head. Deep aroma, plenty of Morello cherries, fruity, woody, sour, a bit funky. Dry but soft mouthfeel, no residual sugars, with a moderate acidity level, sour cherry juice, light tannins, some late astringency.Lovely, although I preferred other Kriek with a more evident funky character.
750ml at Armin's. pours bright rose dark tinted red. Aroma is sour tart vinegar strawberry cherry. Taste is nice smooth cherry tart strawberry acidic.

Bottle at Armins with friends, courtesy of Eric. Pour is deep maroon with a frothy pink head and great lacing. Big fruity, jammy, raspberry, lightly funky, yeasty, sour fruity, berry, and tart aroma. Taste is super fruity, grape jam, light spice, cinnamon, strawberry, dark fruits, bread, funky, and sour grain. Light body with medium carbonation. Such a fruity sour and funky lambic. Nice!

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, dark reddish pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of big cherry pie, ltos of vanilla, more earth, hints of honey, lots of lemon, oak. Taste is a mix of nice cherry, pie cherry, hints of earth,vanilla, oak, finishing nice and sour and slightly sweet.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours unclear dark reddish with a small purple head. Strong fruity aroma, juicy berries, cherry. Taste is delicious, thick juicy, light tart,intense fruity all the way, to the long dry finish.
.

Ça sent létabli et ça goute le caca de cheval mais dans un bon sens. Les cerises sont présente et agréable et le mouthfeel est sec et acide. Jaime bien, du moins ma bière de foin au caca préféré jusqua date.

Bottled at SBWF.  Clear cherryred, small pink head. Super intense Schaerbeekse cherry aroma. Tart with underlying fruit sweetness, rich and complex with lemon and barnyard meets these lovely intense cherries. Just mindblowing.
Cherries and poop, very rich delicate cherries and sweetness, light lambic flavors in the back, barnyard and poop

375 ml bottle sampled at the Side Project release bottle share. Pours a deep ruby red with a small tinted head. Massive tart cherries, good oaky funk, vinous notes, some earth, and a tiny bit of vinegar. Medium-bodied, with a tart mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Fruity and funky. I liked this one a lot.

Bottle. Dark red. Very strong horsy/stable aroma, probably the most intense Ive had in a beer, like a Musar wine. Overripe, slight fermented cherries underneat. Dry, slight acidic. A bit short though. Malty bready. I was really impressed with the nose, but the body isnt really that special.

Bottle shared by Matt, thanks for sharing this Matt! Pours a dark red with a thin pink head, the aroma has a good amount of funk and sourness mixed in with the cherries, as it warmed it opened up a little more and the fruit showed more than the tartness, the flavor has a tart fruit front end with some of the funk in the finish, not mouth puckering sour by any means, really a good mix between sour and sweet at the same time, its like it couldnt make up its mind what it wanted to be, still really enjoyed this one.

Thin, red head. I likes me some thin redheads.Hell, i likes me some pleasingly plump redheads.Hell, i married a gorgeous redhead! Ya gotta watch them redheads though. They get firey and can be tough to deal with some times. This one aint too tough though.She smells of Sweet cherry and is a tad funky and tart, playful, juicy and seductive, kinda like my wifey. She tastes juicy, spicy and she caresses my palate in a spritely manner.Nicely prickly and awakening with that "fire down below" finish i love so much. Ohhh, redheads rule! Intense? Indeed.Thanks Art!

Bottle from Tipples to tulip glass. Pours a deep dark red with a very smal bright pink head thanks to a vigorous pour. Big sweet and sour cherry and vinegar aroma, dry, and maybe a hint of the oak and vanilla. Flavor is sour cherry vinegar up front with an oaky finish. A bit of a musty undertone. Not as dry and effervescent as I expected, with only low to medium carbonation. Lingering cherry malt left on the palate. Very much on the lambic and wheat flavor more so than the cherry overall, which is good and keeps it from being medicinal like I get from some krieks. Overall a solid offering, but would not spend $18.99 again for 12.7 oz.
Bottle. Cherry cola and a thin pink head. Aroma is tart, cherries and earthy funk. Taste follows suit and adds some wood. Medium dry palate. Good flavor and nuance.
Bottle @ sbwf13. Deep red, pink head. Intense kriek aroma for sure, cherrypie, candy sweetness in flavor. Too sweet for me-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Sample at SBWF 2013. 

Deep red with a small pinkish head. A lot of cherries both in the aroma and taste. Also wood and some almond. Refreshing and nicely drinkable. Not extremely sour and with a fairly big body. Excellent stuff.

375ml bottle shared by Doug, thanks 
Clear deep red with a small pink head and some lacing. Aroma of cherries, fruit and sweet malts. Flavors of cherries, tart, dusty, grapes with a dry finish 
Very nice and tasty

375 c&c from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours a dark purpley red with a transient dark reddish head. Aromas of slightly sweet cherries. Odd that. Med body or nearly. Flavor is extremely dark cherry with some serious lactic sour, but the cherry sugars are seriously balancing that. Then another quaff makes the mouth shrink from cherry sour. Good stuff - its changing my mouth from quaff to quaff. Getting more sour with time. Incredibly tasty ale.

375mL thanks to Travlr as a going away present. Was supposed to cellar this one but oh, well. Pours a clear, inky purple. Low pink foam with sheety lacing. Nose is salty, briny, loads of that heavy phenol that plagues the normal 3F Oude Kriek and Schaarbekse Kriek. Band-aid phenols blend with hefty green olive brine in the nose. Theres really no way to get around it. The taste is salty, dusty, moderate cardboard, flashes of intense lactic acid. Camphor medicinal numbing sensation on the tongue. Pairing with some intense food, the palate cleans up to something fruit juicy and slightly tannic like pinot noir. Clean lactic bite. But as FlacoAlto and biggirlpanties said it overall comes across too much like fruit juice. Nose finally dumps the band-aid phenols but it takes a solid 30-40 minutes. Juicy fruit medley in its place. Long, exaggerated tannins in the finish create a slate/chalk dry and tastebud puckering sensation.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours deep purple/red with very low pink head. Aroma is of extreme cherries, sugar, berries, slight funk. Taste is of cherries, berries, barnyard, tartness, slight acid. Palate: Light-medium body. Good balance. Overall: Awesome aroma. Dirty cherries in there.

Bottle shared by Tom10101, thanks! Pours intense (yes) red with tiny pinkish head. Aromaamazing cherries, berry jam, barnyard. Acidity is well balanced. Slight hint of sugar. Awesome beer, kriek doesnt get any better than that!

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. green bottle corked and capped poured into a tulip. Pours translucent crimson with small pink head. Aroma is tart cherry, light body, low carbonation, and medium small bubble lacing. Taste is some cherry, tartness, and slightly dry finish. Expected a bit more cherry.
C&C bottle. Deep Cherry red pour, with a thin head. Really dense sweet cherry flavor, tart dried cherries, funk, light grain, and leather. Very juicy cherry, really good.

Bottle from Belmont. Quite an experience, being able to get a beer like this locally. Pours a deep reddish color with a large white head. A large bursting nose of cherries, wood, some sugars. The flavor is dominated by sweet ripe cherry juice, light woody tart lambic, brown sugar. Light mustiness. Very good. Drinkable as hell.

375 mL bottle, huge thanks to Greg and Dan Shelton! Beautiful rich garnet with bright pink undertones and a lighter pink head. Nose and flavor are absolutely outrageous rich cherry, cinnamon, touches of almond and marzipan, sour deep fruit, incredibly full and amazing tart cherry character. Not quite Hommage, but otherwise maybe the best Drie Fonteinen fruit lambic Ive had to date. Absolutely outstanding.
Bottle purchased at Blacklick Wine & Spirits. Dark red pour with a medium pink head. Aroma of sourness, a bit of minty menthol and lots of cherry. Cherry pie flavor with a big sour cherry finish.

375ml bottle, from West Lakeview Liquors. Pours a deep, dark, ruby red with a think pink head. Aroma is yeasty, funky, bready, cherry. Medium on the palate with light, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet and sour, cherry, funk, oak, grassy, more cherry, with a dry, sour, funky finish. This beer is fantastic, but as other have noted, it is pricey.

375 ml corked bottle. A hazy dark and deep red beer, with a large, frothy/fizzy, fully diminishing pink/red head. The aroma is lightly to moderately yeasty (barnyard, leather), with a very strong note of cherry, other notes of wood, red grapes and a touch of citrus. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, heavily acidic. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, long finish with light bitterness. Is this fruity! Ultra cherryish aroma and flavor., with a winey feeling. You cant go wrong with 3 Fonteinen
Evidemment cest conçu de mains de maitre, vraiment pas trop sucré, acidité moyenne et secheresse aride. Juste merci.
Poured from a 375ml bottle, thanks to Doug. Pours deep ruby, pomegranate. Cherry flesh, cherry skins, tart, brettanomyces character, citrusy. Very good.
Bottle share by Jared, Nice cranberry/merlot pour, aroma of cranberries and cinnamon pie filling. Taste is very similar, delish.
Ruby red with no head. Smell of cherry and must. Too young right now, needs time to develope

375 ml bottle. Deep ruby red, slightly hazy with small pink head. Aroma heavy with cherries, pith, and peels, slight funk and oak. Taste is a bit harsher than expected, lots of fruity acids, sour cherries and nice funky notes.

Bottle: Pour is murky ruby red in hue, with a one finger, fine bubbled pink head in this glass - interestingly the pink head swirls, albeit slightly, with white. It rings the glass, a light haze, but retention is light here. The nose is the highlight for me; revealing souring cherry skins and juice, with some dusty funk, lemon zest is present, moving to bready malts. The flavor profile is tart initial; more lemon zest and grassy hops, moving to souring cherry pits and juice, with more funk and dry notes, while revealing peppery spicing, and finally moving to a simple puckering sourness and it is then that I found that this one was simply fantastic.

Bottle with thanks to MrHangover! Pours deep clear ruby red with minimal head and little lacing. Aroma is lightly tart and fruity, strong cherries, just a bit of barnyard. Flavor is over the top cherry, lying on top of a bit of funky barnyard. Initially tart, then fading sweet, then drying out to tartness again. Overall I would say this is medium tart and lightly sweet. Medium body, flat carbonation. Very interesting beverage...

375ml bottle into a wine glass. Bottled 13-11-2012. Opens with a slight fizz. Purchased off the shelf for a painful $22...

A - Pours a clear deep red/violet color with a fingers worth of off-white foam. Disappears quickly leaving behind nothing at all. Minimal lacing but really not a whole lot going on...it just looks like a glass of red wine.

S - Juicy cherries, oak, and vinegar. Some off smelling acid and cinnamon rounds it out but it is missing that stereotypical 3F funk. Really great cherry notes though.

T - Tart cherry juice, oak, and lactic acid. Some tonic water aftertaste. Very unimpressive while cold but letting it warm up improves it slightly. Really just one dimensional. A little bit prickly, but its pretty much dead flat which doesnt help with the flavors.

O - Expensive, flat, and sort of boring. This was just not very good. The aroma is nice but this is a serious downgrade over the standard Oude Kriek.
37,5cl bottle BB 11/2017 Looks ruby red. A lot of cherries in the nose. Not that much of carbonation. Taste not that sour with lots of cherries and some wine notes.Nice beer.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2013 7 sept 2013, tap. Red. Nose is cobwebs, basement, and tart cherries. Thin body, a bit dry, dainty fizzy. Tastes like sour cherry lifesavers (just not sweet), faint oak. Absolutely amazing! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
375 ml bottle. Pours a dark red with no head. Aromas of barnyard, wood, and dark cherries. Flavours of dark bitter cherries. Sour and tart with dry bitter finish. Superb

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Pours a dark cherry color with a pinkish head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of cherries (skin and meat), vegetal. Taste is dry with tart cherries and cherry pits. Fruity in a classy way. Acidity level under control, not much funk. Body is light to medium with moderate carbonation. This right here is my best oude kriek ever.
Syrligt körsbärsvin med mjuk smak och snäll alkohol som förstärks av tät kolsyra och liten sötma.

Deep, pitty, smoky cherry flavors. Quinine; banana skin. Juicy with medium acidity. Near-flat. Thick. Chuggable. Delicious. This should age like a gem. I may not touch any of my further bottles for at least 3 years; I wouldnt hesitate to put 10-20 on this. My only worry is the lack of acidity may harm aging, but it is possible the intense juiciness and sugars and merely covering up the acids.
Pours deep ruby into a tumbler. Pink head with little retention recedes to nothing. Cherry and oak aromas. Sweet cherry upfront turning tart before the dry lasting oak finish.
Big cherry aroma, some mintiness in the smell. Flavor is a sweeter kriek but nice.
Bottle. Pours a deep reddish color with a small pinkish head. Has a fruity rich cherry and cherry pit aroma. Fruity sour tart cherry and almond flavor. Has a fruity sour tart cherry finish.

Mash-up. Small head. Intens purpel. Cherry very pronounced. Light tart. Some sweetness in the back back Ground. Dry finish. Nice though.

Sampled @ RB Danish Summer Gathering 2013 day 1, Ulfborg. Bottle. Very dark red to purple color, small pinkish head. Smell some fruityness and sourish. Taste is very nice actually: cherries, balanced sourness, red fruit. Great example of this style. Very nice indeed!
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, Ulfborg. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is red. Aroma and taste are rich cherries, malt, fruits, acid and malt. Nice and sour.
Bottle, 5%. Deep red/ruby with small pink head. Aroma is malt, cherries, marzipan and tart. Flavour is malt, cherries, marzipan, medium sweet, little tart, little acid and medium dry.
Bottle @ TSODRBSG13, Ulfborg. Clear deep ruby with a pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy cherries and almond. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 300813

375 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a deep and fairly opaque cherry with lighter cherry-tined lacing and soft carbonation. Smells and tastes solid; ceriies and mild funk. Average on the palate. Undercarbonated and overpriced, but enjoyable nonetheless.

375ml bottle. It pours a bit hazy deep dark red with a medium sized pink head that disappears quickly. Very cherry-dominated aroma, tart, horse, fruity. Lots of cherry in the taste, lots of core, fruity. Low carbonation, medium body. Good and fruity but lacks complexity.

Bottle. Pours dark red. Aroma is vinegar, cherries, barnyard, funk and acidic. Taste is medium sour, light sweet. Nice long finish, big cherry and other red fruits. Average carbonation, thin texture and medium body. Pretty good.
0.375l bottle. Ruby body, pink head. Aroma of sour cherry and balsamic vinegar with winous notes. Really intense sour cherry taste with some sherry brandy. Decent beer, thats for sure.

Aroma: Smelling of vinegar, almonds, cherries and stable.Appearance: A foggy red colored beer. A pink head with small lacing and some curtains.Taste: Tasting of vinegar, almonds, cherries and stable.Palate: Medium high carbonation, a coarse texture. A medium body with a good dry finish.Overall: Promising. Very fruity.Note: Bottle 375 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2013-08-24.

Bottle at Gollem. This was on my hitlist. Dark red, small pink head. Aroma is cherry, not much else. Little bit of funk but hardly there. Taste is good and fruity, but not so exciting. Cant believe this has such a high score. 40% cherries, 100% disappointing compared to the usual oude kriek. Not horrible but loses marks for being totally boring and overpriced.

Pours a deep ruby red with a finger of pink foam that fizzes out quickly. The nose has a big dark cherry punch with a touch of vinous booze. The palate follows with big cherry wine notes mingling with tart acidity and a bit of basement must. Touch acetic on the finish.... Really just want to drizzle it over roasted duck and chow down !

Doften otroligt bärig typ svarta vinbär. Man känner även en viss karaktär av stall. Smaken är mörka bär som omogna hallon och körsbär, även ganska jästig. Otroligt fin balans mellan syran och det söta. Väldigt god öl!

12.7 oz. bottle. Deep purple color in a snifter. Nose smells like a cherry wine. Taste again is more on the vino side, ripe, tart cherry hints of sourness. Mouthfeel leaves a light pucker in the back taste buds. Large wine aspects. Interesting

375ML Bottle, Shelton Brothers label, enjoyed at fridge temp in a wine glass and allowed to warm up.

A - Pours almost still, a minimal cherry colored head around the edge of the glass. Purple bubbles arise during the glass swirl. The beer itself is bright ruby red at the pour but looks deep purple in the glass.

S - This smells like a cherry wine with a mild level of tart. Intense is certainly the best way to describe this. Smells like cherry fruit juice.

T - WOW. Well, this is a freaking intense cherry bomb! Holy crap. Cherries for miles with a nice sour lambic taste but thats completely overwhelmed by the cherry taste from start to finish. Mouth swish brings forward more medicinal qualities like Dimetapp Cherry Flavor cough syrup.

M - Sweet and smooth, medium body.

O - I cant easily describe this one. Its very good but certainly needs to be shared with a friend. 375ML is actually too much for one person.

Bottle. Deep red/ruby liquid with small to medium pink head. Aroma of almonds, cherries, light funk, barnyard, apples and lemons. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of cherries, apples, lemons and light funk. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice.
nice cherry core aroma,red, light red foame,light sweetness, medium sourness, nice sour cherry finish.

Deep red coloured. Has a pink head, mostly lasting. Heavy aroma, cherries, almonds, faint cinnamon. Dry notes too. Flavor starts without any sweetness. Moderate acid, light bitter finish. Heavy astringent. Soft carbonation.

Bottle traded by JtClockwork. Aroma is great fake cherry pie filling with a hint of vinegar. Pours cartoonishly red with a nice filmy head. Taste is a little unexpected. A light bready opening with a huge cherry pie finish. Not so much tart as fruity. Thankfully by not being tart, it doesnt taste like a sugar bomb. A pleasant kriek but not up to the 3F standard IMO.

Bottle at Gollem in Antwerp. Dark, deep crimson verging on purple. Huge cherry nose, dust, some leather, plus cherry skins and pips. big cherry flavor with leather and yogurt. Not much sourness, just nice fruit. No complexity whatsoever. A tasty beer, but nowhere near as good as their regular kriek. Kind of a joke at this high price. Just made to sell expensively to beer geeks?
Mörkt rubinröd. Riktigt härlig doft och härliga kirschbär. Balanserad frisk syra och som gör skäl för namnet intense. Kan bli kul med några års lagring

Bottle through recent trade opened with little action on the cork. Pour has a plumb purple color and a ring of pink head on the glass. Aroma has loads of earthy fresh cherry but no big sweetness, musty yeast, light sourness, leather, cherry skins, wet oak, and cherry pits. Amazing how the cherry steals the show but does not do it through brut force. Mouth feel is medium light and the carbonation is not very strong but it is there. Flavor again has a bold fruit side, such a nice sour side, cherry skin bitterness, and it does work it out to the dry side with a nice lingering pucker. There are a lot of the qualities I love in other beers from this brewer and it shares the toungue smacking sour side mixed into such well done wood. I am not generally a fan of cherry but once again I am incredibly impressed!

Red colour with a small pinkish head. Aroma is cherries, mild totffee, cherry stones as as well as mild marzipan. Flavour is cherries, vanilla, some mild wood as well as cherry stones and some mild nuttyness.

Bottled. Deep dark red coloured. Reddish white dense head. Aroma: Immense cherries, sweetness, some sourness and grape. Flavour: Sour cherries, grape, citrus, some wood. Medium to full bodied. Ends grapy and sourish with a nice touch of cherries. Not the worst beer of my now 9000 tasted. Thx. yespr for this.

Bottle: Served in a old Belle Vue Gueuze glass: Thanks to Tinus for this bottle:
Beautiful red pour. Beautiful deep dark red colored beer with a lively beautiful dark pink red colored foamy head. Disappears right away and leaves a beautiful headless beer. Wow!
